We have a retail location as well as supplying stores with our VapoRight and Taste E-Liquids products all over the USA. Sr. TME for Desktop Processor Marketing and Lab Manager Intel Corporation June 2006  –  April 2011  (4 years 11 months) I currently develop and execute the desktop processor marketing demo strategy. I also develop and manage demos for our division's key events such as ISMC, the ATZ at IDF, and IRUM. I develop the desktop processor demo guide for use in the field and channel as well as supply parts and demos for other organizations such as Corp Demos and SSG. I also manage the desktop processor lab in Hillsboro. Sr Technical Marketing Engineer Intel Corporation September 1993  –  April 2011  (17 years 8 months) I design, build and give computer and technology demonstrations. I Write technical documentation, develop classes and demonstrations for training. I also debug and test new technologies as well as write code for Java and Flash. Sr. DPS Xeon Technical Marketing Engineer Intel Corporation April 2003  –  June 2006  (3 years 3 months) Worked with multiple development teams in SSG and EPG to define and develop the future versions of Software Development Platforms (SDP) for distribution to internal and external customers. I define and drive the technologies enabling roadmaps for the Xeon development platforms as well as drive SSG technical needs in board and system meetings. I create the technical and marketing documentation for all of the Xeon SDP as well. Technical Marketing Engineer Intel Corporation September 1999  –  April 2003  (3 years 8 months) Manage, develop and deliver Intel corporate demonstrations for use in executive keynote presentations and tradeshows around the world. I work across Intel divisions to identify technologies and create timelines, messaging, and support requirements for event demonstrations. I then create, reproduce, and document demos before shipping to various locations and performing the demos on stage. Technical Marketing Engineer and Unix lead Intel Corporation November 1996  –  September 1999  (2 years 11 months) Managed all aspects of Server product completeness within EMSD as well as coordinated and provided Unix support across all EMSD platforms. I was involved with project leadership, investigation and disposition of errata, writing technical documents and training in support of ESG's products during design, development, and production phases. Interfaced with many Intel/ESG internal groups such as design engineering, system validation, compatibility labs, product marketing and business development, as well as external groups such as FSEs/FAEs and Major OEM/Distribution customers. Designed and taught 6 top ranked courses at Intel field sales conferences. Account Technical Marketing Engineer Intel Corporation September 1995  –  November 1996  (1 year 3 months) Technical customer interface for major accounts (Fujitsu/NEC/NCR/Micron/DG). Managed the closure of technical issues, communication of product updates and changes with server production products. Tracked, prioritized, and solved application/product issues reported by OEM customers, driving resolution across divisions both at Intel and customer sites. Author of technical white papers, engineering guidelines and other technical documents necessary for supporting our products. Communicated future customer requirements to product development and assisted in feature definition of new server products. Chaired customer and OEM meetings for business unit issue closure. Designed and implemented the OZZY subset of Intel servers. Configured our Internet connections including CSD/DSU's, Cisco router, and Ascend pipeline routers. Summary Over my 14 year career at Intel I have worked in software development, software validation, program management, and a technical marketing engineer for both hardware (LAN 1gig) and software (Linux, OpenStack, and Android). I have a broad understanding of the entire gamut of computers and related technologies including understanding how high speed differential signals propagate, how firmware interacts with hardware, how BIOS and the chipsets interact, and the many different programming languages.  
 
I enjoy the work I do now and am focusing on improving my Android technical depth across the entire OS software stack. I take a particular interest in how companies strategically respond to competition which is why I pursued an MBA earlier in my career. My goal is to continue working as a TME while I build a strong technical depth on Android with plans to eventually move into a strategic planning or marketing role. I enjoy the work I do now travelling to meet customers, developing product demos, and solving complex technical issues. Experience Technical Marketing Engineer Intel Corporation February 2011  – Present (4 years 7 months) Hillsboro, OR TME working for the Intel(r) Open Source Technology Center (OSTS) supporting Android, OpenStack, Mission Critical Linux, and MeeGo.  
 
1) Led and personally established the initial Android customer support process for tablets for a worldwide team of TME's spread across 5 countries.  
2) Developed compelling Android demos that showed some of Intel's first Atom processors for Android tablets running fast and smooth. 
3) Developed and showed demos on OpenStack for COSBench, Trusted Compute Pools, and single-bit/multi-bit error injection that show Intel's lead in this area.  
4) Conceived of, developed, and scripted several video training's around Android on Intel. See below for examples. 
 
http://software.intel.com/en-us/videos/android-ics-emulator-for-mac-os-with-intel-hardware-accelerated-execution-manager 
 
http://software.intel.com/en-us/videos/android-ics-emulator-for-ubuntu-with-kvm-acceleration-supported-by-intel-vt-x 
 
http://software.intel.com/en-us/videos/android-ics-emulator-for-microsoft-windows-with-intel-hardware-accelerated-execution-manager 
 
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=If8C6xX1mpg 
 
Most recently (2014 and 2015) I have been working on Intel's Reference Device for Android program which has successfully met its goal to provide over the air updates of the latest Android version with 2 weeks of each major release. This program aims to solve a major headache in the industry by providing a semi-custom reference platform that ODM's/OEM's can bring to market quickly that will always run the latest Android version. The first IRDA device that I worked on is the TrekStor SurfTab tablet http://www.trekstor.de/detail-surftabs-en/product/surftab-xintron-i-70.html and is already running the latest Android version. Technical Marketing Engineer Intel Corporation March 2007  –  February 2011  (4 years) Hillsboro, OR TME working in LAN Access Division supporting MNC's such as Dell on their integrated LOM (Lan On Motherboard) hardware designs for the Intel vPro platform. 
-Reviewed Customer hardware schematics/layouts and fixed the customers design mistakes saving them money in unnecessary board spins 
-Developed Sales and Training presentations that were delivered on site in Korea, Japan, China, Taiwan, and the USA 
-Secured design wins for Intel contributing millions of dollars to the LAN division 
-Provided second line support for hardware and software related LAN issues to customers like LGE, Acer, Asus, Quanta, etc.. 
-IEEE testing, conformance, and debug 
-Improved team processes such as consolidating all of the best layout guidelines for all products into a single source document to help over 20 other coworkers and all customers. This was a one year commitment meeting weekly with some of the top engineers at Intel to work through complicated details. - Forecasted and tracked budget for equipment and contractors  
- Developed processes and tools to track the verification of hundreds of Viiv candidates targeted for 10 different countries 
- Developed project schedules for three major releases of Viiv working with engineers across multiple groups and GEOs. 
- Oversaw defect management process and audited the results of engineers.

Validation Program manager for the Intel® Channel Marketplace Program

Developed and documented the teams defect management process with Tibet and created the templates all validation engineers follow for the Software Test Plans and Test Descriptor Specifications. Project managed a global team in development of the Microsoft .NET Online CD Contents Management System.

Developed a new HTML CD GUI interface that reduced the time required to make CDs by 40%, reduced errors in coding, and improved functionality. 
 
Implemented the Doors 7.0 database and web server, a requirements document management system used by teams to develop product specifications.
